basics.name: John Liu
basics.summary: Experienced mechanical engineer with a strong foundation in core engineering first principles. Proven track record in impacting cross-functional teams to deliver complex products from concept through full-rate production.

work.summary: Led battery system quality initiatives for Apple's consumer products.
highlights: Led the redesign of battery pack components on the M3 iPad Air to eliminate battery tab crack, enhancing product reliability and safety
Lifted quality alert on ~1M Airpods Pro 2nd gen Case due to pouch breach risk by lowering the DPPM
Spearheaded a $500K cost-saving initiative over the Airpods 4th gen production lifetime by optimizing metrology equipment
Improved battery pack yield by 25% on the Airpods Pro 2nd gen buds by qualifying two new tag vendors
Increased pack yield by 50%, saving $600k through the Airpods 4th gen production lifetime

work.summary: Developed thermal management solutions for iPhone manufacturing.
highlights: Qualified a second source vendor and led development of improved B-PET material, resulting in $1.5M savings over iPhone 15 and 15 Pro lifetime
Enhanced production line efficiency from 30% to 60% resulting in cost savings of $180k/line
Developed a new synthetic graphite width by optimizing sintering temperature profile through TGA, SEM and DOE studies

work.summary: Contributed to electric vehicle battery pack and body structure design.
highlights: Developed engineering reports to drive future battery pack design by analyzing existing structures
Redesigned the torque box to optimize for mass and assembly efficiencies (40% mass reduction)
Contributed to NPI project by establishing design direction for new pickup structure

work.summary: Improved manufacturing precision and quality for Tesla vehicle production.
highlights: Reduced production downtime and improved dimensional issues for Model Y front underbody assembly
Developed data analysis tool for Model S/X/Y to detect dimensional issues and visualize metrology data
Corrected dimensional issues to fall within 10% of tolerance in Model 3/X/Y underbody
